meanings.definition: A meeting of members of a political party to select candidates or decide policy.
meanings.sent1: During the caucus, the party members discussed their plans for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: The caucus was held to decide who would represent the party in the election.
meanings.sent3: At the caucus, they debated whether to have pizza or sandwiches for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The caucus was like a chess game, with each move carefully planned out.
meanings.sent5: The caucus room buzzed with excitement as decisions were being made.

meanings.definition: To hold or form a caucus.
meanings.sent1: They decided to caucus after the main meeting to discuss further.
meanings.sent2: She caucused with a few members to finalize the details.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to caucus under the shade of a big tree.
meanings.sent4: He caucused with his closest allies to come up with a plan.
meanings.sent5: Caucusing in the park, they made important decisions for the group.

meanings.definition: A group within an organization or political party that meets separately to discuss strategy.
meanings.sent1: The caucus within the party focused on their campaign strategy.
meanings.sent2: The small caucus met in a quiet room to plan their next move.
meanings.sent3: During the caucus, they joked about their secret handshakes.
meanings.sent4: The caucus operated like a well-oiled machine, always in sync.
meanings.sent5: In the dimly lit room, the caucus members shared their ideas openly.
